page.title: 01Description of area.
page.content: The area is nearly totaly agricultural.There are a few hectares of tree plantation,one small quarry now being infilled with rubbish, and a small open-cast sight expected to produce about 50,000 tonnes of medium grade coking coal. The population of the area is very small.The largest settlement is the village of{Bolam}with a population of 75.There is also a smaller hamlet to the west of the area called {Evenwood {Gate. The ammenities are very poor,with people having to travel 3-5 miles either to West Auckland in the north or to Staindrop in the south.The main areas of population are Bishop Auckland 7 miles to the nort-west and Darlington 11 miles to the south-east.
